title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Bucks Fall as Rice's Historic Night Powers Hornets**

MILWAUKEE — On a night where offense was a premium, Glen Rice authored a masterpiece. The Charlotte Hornets’ sharpshooter delivered a breathtaking, career-defining performance, pouring in a game-high 48 points to single-handedly will his team to a gritty 94-87 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

From the opening tip, it was clear Rice was in a different stratosphere. While both teams struggled to find consistent rhythm, Rice was a study in scoring efficiency, a flurry of mid-range jumpers and driving layups that the Bucks had no answer for. His singular brilliance cut through the defensive slog, providing the Hornets with an anchor in an otherwise choppy contest.

The Bucks, led by Vinny Del Negro’s 21 points and Ray Allen’s 18, fought valiantly to stay within striking distance. They chipped away at Charlotte’s lead, but every time Milwaukee threatened, Rice had a response. Whether it was a clutch three-pointer or a contested fadeaway, his scoring barrage was an unstoppable force, demoralizing the home team’s defensive efforts possession by possession.

Rice’s 48-point explosion was not merely a high-volume output; it was a historic, carry-your-team-on-your-back performance that accounted for over half of the Hornets’ total points. Without his heroics, Charlotte’s offense would have flatlined.

In the end, the story was simple and singular: Glen Rice. On a night his team needed every ounce of offense, he delivered one of the most memorable individual performances of the season, stealing a hard-fought road win and cementing a night that belonged entirely to him.
